About Me

Hi, my name is Sam. I am an interdisciplinary creative with an interest in technology, music, and networked art.

I’m currently in the process of upgrading my coding skills in NodeJS and Rust.

I am most skilled in:
Creative problem solving and troubleshooting

Projects

On Air Warning

An explainer video for On Air Warning. Check out the rest of the channel for more detailed tutorials.

On Air Warning is a 3-light video conference indicator born out of the Work From Home boom of 2020. I have performed a variety of roles as assistant to the CEO, including handling the motion graphics, voiceover, original music, and video editing for the tutorials on OAW’s YouTube channel. Check out one of many examples above, and feel free to peruse the product website

Audio Programming in Max/MSP

A example of my abilities programming in Max/MSP.

Max/MSP is a visual programming language designed for audiovisual artists. Like many people of a similar ilk, I discovered my interest in coding with the help of Max’s friendly layout and detailed documentation. While I’ve done all of my work in this field as a hobbyist, my immersion in it has strenthened my ability to think in modular terms, which I find gives me an advantage in learning new programming languages efficiently. Feel free to clone the repo and try out the program yourself.

Education

Reed College

BA in Music

2016-2020

Reed is a small-ish liberal arts college in Portland, Oregon with rigorous academics and a spirit of open-mindedness.

My time at Reed was marked by significant growth and transformation. I went in thinking I’d be a Theatre or French major. I ultimately majored in Music. In the process of studying electronic music, I discovered my interest in technology more broadly. This snowballed into a desire to work with computers, which is the reason you’re reading this right now. :)

A Little More About Me

  • Literature
  • Generative AI Art
